page.title: 19N.C.D.L. Kennels
page.content: Situated just off the A44 road at Wickhamford is a branch of the National Canine Defence League. This has existed for 20 years and,at the present time,has 83 dogs of all kinds.These are mainly stray dogs brought in by the local police,or dogs which have suffered ill treatment. There are various types of kennels including some with tops on the runs for dogs which are good at jumping. Some kennels were specially designed with infra_red heaters for older dogs with arthritis. Members of the public are encouraged to look around, and in fact an open day is held. Many people fortunately give homes to the stray dogs.Some dogs ,however,are unsuitable for living in a private house and they spend their life at the kennels.People,who have no dogs,sponsor these.
